There‚Äôs a reason carbon pricing has been around so long. It‚Äôs a great way to reduce emissions quickly, while supporting the economy. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre continuing to advocate for it, across the globe.
Carbon pricing: fair, efficient and widely acknowledged as one of the most effective tools to bring down carbon emissions. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre continuing to advocate for its expansion.

Carbon pricing incentivizes companies to emit less and innovate more. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre advocating for well-designed policies. Read more from our CEO about the promising movement on this fair and efficient way to help the world get to net zero.

Earlier today our CEO Bernard Looney announced BP's bold new purpose and ambition #bpNetZero. If you missed it, here are some of the highlights:

@xrwsm We want to help the world get to net zero too; the whole energy system needs to be transformed, and everyone has a part to play---producers and sellers of energy, users of energy and policy-makers 2/2
@xrwsm We are aiming to make absolute reductions, to net zero, of the carbon in the oil and gas we dig out of the ground, by 2050 or sooner, and net zero for our own operations as well  1/2

@jmagreen @ottermarie Hi Juan, our new ambition tackles Scope 3 head on. We're not just aiming to halve the carbon intensity of our products - as others seek to do. We're aiming for net zero on an absolute basis for the carbon associated with the oil & gas we dig out of the ground #bpNetZero

@MagaliProvensal We know the pace & direction of travel we're setting out will be insufficient for some people. But from today onward, our ambition is clear: We are heading for net zero - there is no turning back
@MagaliProvensal Hi there, we don't have all of the answers yet. We will come back in September with more details on our plans for the first five years. Stay tuned
@Happieststeve AND We're aiming to cut the carbon intensity of the products we sell by 50% (Aim 3) - by 2050 or sooner 2/2

@Happieststeve We're aiming to make absolute reductions, to net zero, of around 415 million tonnes of emissions ‚Äì 55 million from our operations (Aim 1) & 360 million from the carbon in our upstream production (Aim 2) - both by 2050 or sooner 1/2

There are numerous elements making the price of a litre of petrol or diesel:  
a) Government duty and tax (66%)
b) The cost of petrol and diesel on the open market - (28%)
c) The costs and profit of the wholesaler & retailer - Retail/Ex-Refinery spread (6%)

Dudley: ‚ÄúWe are part way through a big hump in energy demand ‚Äì largely created by the growth of industry in China.‚Äù #BPstats #BP
Dudley: ‚ÄúNearly all of that growth is accounted for by emerging economies ‚Äì China and India particularly.‚Äù #BPstats #BP
